title: [$250] Middle truncate all lists in the RHP, categories, and tags

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Slack conversation - https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1758753730735929 ## Problem Users are unable to fully view credit card account names when selecting a card to export company card expenses in the RHP. The account names are truncated, making it difficult to distinguish between cards. This issue was observed during onboarding calls and confirmed by internal team members. ## Why is this important? Truncated account names hinder usability and create confusion, particularly when multiple similar cards exist. This affects the user experience during a critical workflow and can lead to errors in selecting the correct account. Multiple users, including those with large displays, report this limitation. It also negatively impacts adoption for teams using hierarchical tags or categories. ## Solution Implement middle truncation (e.g., "Americ...1234") for consistency with other UI patterns.

title: Make export onyx state feature have a whitelist of things we can export and have it redact everything else

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: Fire-Cleanup
labels.description: Something needs to be done after a fire

body:
# Problem

The `export onyx state` feature exports all the data in our onyx tables. We had some data privacy issues in the past where things that we should not be exporting were exported, so we want to avoid that by implementing a whitelist. Everything we whitelist, should be exported as is, everything not in the whitelist should be redacted.

We did this for a few keys here https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70230/ and  here https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/70223/ but we want to extend that to all keys. 

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @ishpaul777</details>

title: [$250] Remove the Auditor role from NewDot Collect

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Since the auditor role will no longer be part of the Collect plan in NewDot, we have decided to remove it sooner rather than later to prevent more customers from adopting it. The way this change should work is: - If a member of a Collect workspace currently has the auditor role, we keep their badge and their role as is. - But if they deselect it, then they can't add it back via NewDot. - We'll also no longer display the `auditor` option in the role selector - both for existing members or when inviting new members. Nothing should be changed for the Control plan. cc @trjExpensify

title: [$250] Remove conditional rendering of MoneyRequestParticipantsSelector

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [this proposal ](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1758273437224709) ### Background: In the money request creation flow, users select participants for their expense reports through a multi-step process. When a user creates a new expense, the system first creates an optimistic transaction draft with a temporary ID and stores it in Onyx. The user then navigates through various steps including selecting participants. ### Problem When a participant is selected, the draft transaction is recreated, which forces the participant selector component to remount, triggering heavy recalculations and long freezes on large accounts, preventing users from smoothly completing the expense flow. ### Solution Remove conditional rendering of MoneyRequestParticipantsSelector in IOURequestStepParticipants based on draft transactions amount. This prevents mounting the entire list and unnecessarily doing all the heavy calculations again when users navigate through the expense creation flow. Instead, implement fallback strategy in the function responsible for adding a participant that handles cases where transaction data hasn’t loaded yet from the data store. The fallback detects when transaction objects are still loading and uses the transaction ID (which is always available) to save participant data directly, eliminating the dependency on fully loaded transaction objects. Measurements on iOS on account with ~24k options available in participants screen: - Before: 7.5s - After: 1.3s

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.18-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13177019/test-cases/41237784 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Precondition: Invite a user to a workspace 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Search for the member's workspace chat and send a message 3. Go offline 4. Delete the workspace 5. Go back to the member's workspace chat ## Expected Result: The workspace's chats were archived, you can't sent messages on them There's a banner where the compose box should be that mentions that the Room has been archived ## Actual Result: You can send a message to the member's workspace chat, and there is no banner blocking the compose box. Message will fail to send when you go back online. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bc1ae6dd-229b-4cae-b963-faca66cc8a75 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
